titleStmt.title: W. G. Barnett et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6434

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Todd County Kentucky
May 27th 1865
To His Excellency
The Govenor of Kentucky
Dr Sir

We the undersigned Citizens of Todd county would respectfully petition your Honor to remit a fine rendered at the April Term of the Todd Circuit court (1865) in favor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against W. W. Grady for the sum of Seventy five Dollars for shooting with intent to kill a Horse the property of J. W. Mobley The Horse shot by Grady as we are informed and believe was a roguish Horse. and the gun used was a shot gun with small bird shot clearly not intended by Grady to kill the Horse

W. G. Barnett
James M Williams
J. R. Finch
L R Irvine
J. W. Ballard
S E G Cole
S. G. Perkins
Wm H Edwards
J D Christian
B T Perkins
John Lindsey
Peyton Simpson
Wm S F Slaughter
G Wallace Garth
G. Terry
S H Grooms
R F Christian

Todd Cir Ct
vs
W. W. Grady
$75
